oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Vibrational excitation cross-sections sigma(nu f <-nu i) (E) in resonant e-F-2 and HCl scattering are calculated from transition matrix elements T-nu f <-nu i(E) obtained using Fourier transform of the cross correlation function tion <phi(nu f) (R) vertical bar Psi(nu i) (R, t)> where Psi(nu i) (R, t) approximate to e(-ihHAB-(R)t)phi(nu i). Time evolution under the influence of the resonance anionic Hamiltonian HAB- (AB=F-2/HCl) is effected using Lanczos reduction technique followed by fast Fourier transform and the target (AB) vibrational eigenfunctions phi(nu i) (R) and phi(nu f) (R) are calculated using Fourier grid Hamiltonian method applied to potential energy (PE) curve of the neutral target. The resulting vibrational excitation cross-sections provide reasonable agreement with experimental and other theoretical results.
